title: Add Internet Identity sign-in button to unauthenticated landing screen

requirements.summary: Show a primary Internet Identity sign-in button on the unauthenticated landing screen and wire it to useInternetIdentity().login(), including loading and error states.
acceptanceCriteria: When `identity` is not present, the landing screen renders a clearly visible button labeled "Sign in with Internet Identity".
Clicking the button calls the `login()` function from `useInternetIdentity` and opens the Internet Identity authentication flow.
While `loginStatus` is "logging-in", the sign-in button is disabled and shows a loading state (e.g., text changes to "Signing in…" or a spinner is shown).
If `loginStatus` is "loginError", an error message is shown on the landing screen using existing UI patterns (e.g., `ErrorState`) and the user can retry by clicking the sign-in button again.

file_operations.description: Update the unauthenticated landing UI to include a clearly visible primary "Sign in with Internet Identity" button. Use the authorization component’s frontend authentication capability (useInternetIdentity) by calling `useInternetIdentity().login()` on click (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing). Bind loading/disabled state to `loginStatus === "logging-in"` (e.g., label becomes "Signing in…"). When `loginStatus === "loginError"`, render an error message using the existing `ErrorState` pattern (and surface `loginError?.message` or a safe fallback) with a retry action that calls `login()` again. Use the existing shadcn-ui Button component for the primary button styling/behavior (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
